oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Coupled-Channel Model for $\bar{K}N$ Scattering in the Resonant Region
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fernandez-Ramirez, C.
Danilkin, I. V.
Manley, D. M.
Mathieu, V.
Szczepaniak, A. P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Phenomenology
Nuclear Theory
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a unitary multichannel model for $\bar{K}N$ scattering in the resonance region that fulfills unitarity. It has the correct analytical properties for the amplitudes once they are extended to the complex-$s$ plane and the partial waves have the right threshold behavior. To determine the parameters of the model, we have fitted single-energy partial waves up to $J=7/2$ and up to 2.15 GeV of energy in the center-of-mass reference frame obtaining the poles of the $\Lambda^*$ and $\Sigma^*$ resonances, which are compared to previous analyses. We provide the most comprehensive picture of the $S=-1$ hyperon spectrum to date. Important differences are found between the available analyses making the gathering of further experimental information on $\bar{K}N$ scattering mandatory to make progress in the assessment of the hyperon spectrum.
Comment: Joint Physics Analysis Center, 28 pages, 19 figures, 3 tables
